You can create an AverageTrueRange indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the AverageTrueRange constructor.

AverageTrueRange()1/2

            AverageTrueRange QuantConnect.Indicators.AverageTrueRange (
     string              name,
     int                 period,
     *MovingAverageType  movingAverageType,
   )

Creates a new AverageTrueRange indicator using the specified period and moving average type.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.
int period The smoothing period used to smooth the true range values.
*MovingAverageType movingAverageType (Optional) /. Default: MovingAverageType.Wilders

Return

AverageTrueRange - The new AverageTrueRange indicator object.

AverageTrueRange - The new AverageTrueRange indicator object.

Definition at line 83 of file Indicators/AverageTrueRange.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.


private AverageTrueRange _atr;

// In Initialize()
_atr = new AverageTrueRange(name, period);
_atr.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _atr, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_atr.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _atr.Current.Value;
}
    
# In Initialize()
self.atr = AverageTrueRange(name, period)
self.atr.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.atr, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.atr.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.atr.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with a TradeBar, QuoteBar, or an IndicatorDataPoint. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

    
private AverageTrueRange _atr;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_atr = new AverageTrueRange(period);
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.QuoteBars.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _atr.Update(data.QuoteBars[symbol]);
}
if (_atr.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _atr.Current.Value;
}
    
# In Initialize()
self.atr = AverageTrueRange(period)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.QuoteBars.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.atr.Update(data.QuoteBars[self.symbol])
if self.atr.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.atr.Current.Value
